question: Which of the following is a coordinating conjunction?
I wanted to go for a run, _____ it started raining heavily.
She can come to the party _____ she finishes her homework.
Identify the coordinating conjunction in the sentence: "She was tired, so she decided to take a nap."
A subordinating conjunction is used to introduce a dependent clause.
He didn't understand the lesson, _____ he asked the teacher for help.
Identify the coordinating conjunction in the sentence: "She likes to read novels and play tennis."
Which of the following is a subordinating conjunction?
Commas are always required when using a subordinating conjunction.
A dependent clause can stand alone as a complete sentence.
You can have tea _____ coffee with your breakfast.
Which of the following is a coordinating conjunction?
I wanted to go for a walk, _____ it was raining heavily.
She can stay at home _____ she can come with us.
I will call you _____ I arrive at the office.
He didn't finish his homework, _____ he had to stay up late.
We decided to stay in _____ the weather was bad.
Which of the following is a subordinating conjunction?
Identify the subordinating conjunction in the sentence: "If you study hard, you will succeed."
Which of the following is a coordinating conjunction?
Choose the sentence that correctly uses a coordinating conjunction.
options: I like to read books, and my brother prefers to watch movies.
Although I like to read books, but my brother prefers to watch movies.
I like to read books, nor my brother prefers to watch movies.
I like to read books yet my brother prefers to watch movies.

question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a subordinating conjunction.
options: It is not Henry who should do it but you.
You can go to the theatre, or watch it online.
I will study hard so that I pass the exam.
We went to the park nor the museum.

question: Identify the coordinating conjunction in the sentence: "He is a doctor, but he also teaches at the university."
Choose the sentence that correctly uses a subordinating conjunction.
options: Keeping a journal and listening to music are my hobbies.
I will go to the movies if you want to come.
Although she tried hard, but she couldn't solve the problem.
He was sleepy nor he went to bed early.

question: Choose the sentence that correctly uses a coordinating conjunction.
options: The weather was sunny, however we decided to stay indoors.
She is a talented artist and a skilled musician.
We waited for the bus, as it never came.
I would like to go to the park, nor the beach.
